snippet: After choosing to restrict hitting in practices, the country’s largest youth football program is still faced with the issue of how much further it may want — or need — to go.
abstract: Pop Warner, the country's largest youth football program, issues new rules that put restriction on the amount of contact players can have in practice; Pop Warner exec director Jon Butler says research will continue to drive the organization's rules changes as it tries to limit concussions.
lead_paragraph: After choosing to restrict hitting in practices, the country’s largest youth football program is still faced with the issue of how much further it may want — or need — to go.

headline.seo: Pop Warner Football Rules Limiting Contact Raise New Questions
headline.main: Pop Warner Weighing Research and Risks in Concussion Prevention Efforts
headline.print_headline: Pop Warner Weighing Research and Risks in Concussion Prevention Efforts
